meanings.definition: To remove from a state or condition.
meanings.sent1: She unstates the messy room by cleaning it up.
meanings.sent2: The magician unstates the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent3: He unstates his messy hair by combing it neatly.
meanings.sent4: The eraser unstates the pencil marks on the paper.
meanings.sent5: The wind unstates the carefully arranged leaves in the garden.

meanings.definition: To negate or reverse a previous action or statement.
meanings.sent1: The apology unstates the hurtful words she said.
meanings.sent2: The judge unstates the previous ruling based on new evidence.
meanings.sent3: His excuse unstates the blame from him to someone else.
meanings.sent4: The undo button unstates the last action on the computer.
meanings.sent5: The rain unstates the footprints on the muddy path.
